fun_facts: A cockroach can live for several weeks without its head.
A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
A sneeze can travel up to 100 miles per hour.
An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain.
Butterflies taste with their feet.
Cats have over 100 vocal cords.
Dolphins sleep with one eye open.
Elephants are the only animals that can't jump.
Giraffes have no vocal cords.
Hippos can run faster than humans.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. It lasted only 38 minutes.
The world's largest snowflake on record was 15 inches wide and 8 inches thick.
The world's largest grand piano was built by a 15-year-old in New Zealand.
The world's oldest piece of chewing gum is over 9,000 years old.
The world's largest rubber band ball weighs over 9,000 pounds.
The shortest complete sentence in the English language is 'I am.'
The longest word in the English language is 189,819 letters long.
The world's largest snow maze is in Warren, Vermont.
The world's largest jigsaw puzzle has over 551,232 pieces.
The world's largest ball of twine weighs over 21,000 pounds.
Kangaroos can’t walk backwards.
A chameleon’s tongue is at least as long as its body.
Cockroaches have white blood!
Cows can walk up the stairs by themselves but can’t get down without help!
Slugs have four noses!
A male ostrich can roar like a lion!
A woman called the police when her ice cream didn’t have enough sprinkles.

The world's largest snow sculpture was a two-part ice sculpture of Niagara Falls and the Crossing of the Bering Strait, measuring 250 meters long, 8.5 meters high, and composed of over 13,000 cubic meters of snow.

People used to say 'prunes' instead of 'cheese' when getting their pictures taken. In the 1840s, a cheesy grin was seen as childish, so a London photographer told people to say 'prunes' to keep their mouths tight. Now you know why people never smiled in old photos.
Blue whale tongues can weigh as much as an elephant. Their hearts can also weigh almost a tonne and only need to beat once every ten seconds.

The world's largest rubber duck is over 79 feet tall.

People used to say 'prunes' instead of 'cheese' when getting their pictures taken. In the 1840s, a cheesy grin was seen as childish, so a London photographer told people to say 'prunes' to keep their mouths tight. Now you know why people never smiled in old photos.
Blue whale tongues can weigh as much as an elephant. Their hearts can also weigh almost a tonne and only need to beat once every ten seconds.
Britain has hedgehogs too.
There are 15 different species of hedgehog, found across Europe, Asia, and Africa.
Hedgehogs mainly stay on the ground, but they are quite good swimmers and can climb trees too.
Hedgehogs have a natural ability to fight off snake venom.
Hedgehogs have a pig-like snout.
